units.title: Clonal organoid establishment from normal crypts
units.text: For clonal organoids from normal crypts, isolated single crypts were embedded in 10 µl Matrigel and cultured in HISM medium.
units.rationale: Describes the initial step to generate clonal organoids from normal tissue.

units.title: Clonal tumour organoid culture and dissociation
units.text: For clonal tumour organoid cultures, tumour cell suspensions were cultured for 7–14 days in HISM without Wnt3A-CM. Then, 10–15 individual organoids were picked and separately dissociated into single cells by TryPLE (Thermo Fisher), washed and suspended in AdMEM containing propidium iodide (PI).
units.rationale: Details how tumour organoids are grown and prepared for single‑cell analysis.

units.title: Single‑cell sorting into organoid medium
units.text: Forty‑eight single cells were sorted into tumour organoid medium (HISM plus 10 µM ROCK inhibitor Y‑27632 (Tocris BioScience); no Wnt‑CM) from each tumour organoid. Sorting was based on FCS area/FCS peak and PIneg/FCS area using a Moflo machine (Beckman Coulter).
units.rationale: Specifies the procedure for isolating individual cells for downstream culture.

units.title: Seeding single cells into 96‑well plates
units.text: Sorted cells were spun down at 1,000g at 4 °C for 5 min, after which single cells were each embedded into 10 µl of basement membrane extract (BME, Amsbio) and seeded into 96‑well plates at a ratio of 1 cell per well.
units.rationale: Provides the method to culture single cells in isolated wells.

units.title: Drug screening assay
units.text: Drug dilutions were performed in two series: 1) stepwise 2‑fold dilutions from 20 µM to 19.5 nM; and 2) stepwise 2‑fold dilutions from 15 µM to 29.3 nM. All drugs were dispensed by a HP‑D300 automated liquid dispenser (TECAN). Samples were incubated for 6 days at 37 °C and cell viability was measured by CellTiter‑Glo 3D kit (Promega) on a SpectraMax M5e (Molecular Devices).
units.rationale: Outlines the high‑throughput drug response measurement protocol.

units.title: DNA and RNA co‑extraction
units.text: DNA and RNA were concomitantly extracted from frozen tissue samples or organoid cultures using AllPrep DNA/RNA minikit (Qiagen 80204).
units.rationale: Describes the simultaneous extraction of nucleic acids for downstream analyses.

units.title: Whole‑genome sequencing library preparation
units.text: We generated paired end sequencing reads (150 bp) using Illumina XTEN machines, resulting in ±30× coverage per sample. Sequences were aligned to the human reference genome (NCBI build37) using BWA‑MEM.
units.rationale: Provides the steps for generating and aligning whole‑genome sequencing data.

units.title: Somatic substitution calling with CaVEMan
units.text: Single‑base somatic substitutions were identified using CaVEMan. For each patient, the only germline reference available was healthy colorectal tissue more than 5 cm from the tumour, consisting of epithelial and connective tissue. In order to allow the discovery of somatic mutations in this tissue we ran CaVEMan using an unmatched normal reference. Germline SNPs were removed by comparison to a panel of 75 unrelated normal samples.
units.rationale: Details the pipeline for detecting point mutations.

units.title: Indel detection with Pindel
units.text: Indels were called using Pindel. Post‑processing filters were the same as for substitutions except that ASMD ≥ 140 and CLPM = 0 were not used.
units.rationale: Specifies the method for identifying insertion‑deletion events.

units.title: Phylogenetic tree construction with Phylip
units.text: Phylogenies were constructed using the Phylip suite of tools. The programme seqboot was used to generate 100 bootstrap replicates of each dataset by resampling the mutations with replacement. Phylogenies were then reconstructed for each bootstrap replicate by maximum parsimony using the Mix programme using the Wagner method, with the fake outgroup as a root. The programme Consense was used to build a consensus of all the trees that had been built for each patient, using the majority rule (extended) option.
units.rationale: Explains the computational workflow for building evolutionary trees.
